title: Motion and Kinematics: Graphical Analysis

vocab.definition: The study of motion without considering the forces that cause it
Change in position of an object
Rate of change of displacement with time
Rate of change of velocity with time
Graph showing how position changes over time

teachingNotes: Focus on interpreting motion graphs. Practice reading slope and area from position-time and velocity-time graphs.

sample.question: What is the study of motion without considering forces?
What does slope of position-time graph show?
What does slope of velocity-time graph show?
What is the unit of velocity?
What is the unit of acceleration?
How do you find displacement from velocity-time graph?

truefalse.question: Velocity is the rate of change of position with time. (True or False)
Acceleration is change in position. (True or False)
Displacement is change in position. (True or False)
Slope of position-time graph is velocity. (True or False)
Slope of velocity-time graph is displacement. (True or False)
Acceleration is rate of change of velocity. (True or False)
Velocity has magnitude and direction. (True or False)
Speed and velocity are exactly the same. (True or False)
Area under velocity-time graph gives displacement. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What does the slope of a position-time graph represent?
What does the slope of a velocity-time graph represent?
What is the study of motion without forces?
What is change in position called?
What measures rate of velocity change?
On a position-time graph, what does a horizontal line mean?
On a velocity-time graph, what does a horizontal line mean?
What does area under velocity-time graph show?
Which has both magnitude and direction?

fillintheblank.question: The rate of change of velocity with time is called _____.
The rate of change of displacement with time is _____.
The study of motion without forces is _____.
The slope of a position-time graph is _____.
The slope of a velocity-time graph is _____.
A _____ graph shows how position changes over time.
Velocity is measured in meters per _____.
The area under a velocity-time graph gives _____.

shortanswer.question: How do you find velocity from a position-time graph?
expectedAny: Find the slope of the line
Change in position over change in time

shortanswer.question: How do you find acceleration from a velocity-time graph?
expectedAny: Find the slope of the line
Change in velocity over change in time

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between velocity and speed?
expectedAny: Velocity has direction, speed does not
Velocity is vector, speed is scalar

shortanswer.question: What does a horizontal line on a position-time graph mean?
What does a straight diagonal line on position-time graph mean?
What does a horizontal line on velocity-time graph mean?
How do you find displacement from velocity-time graph?
expectedAny: Calculate area between graph and axis

shortanswer.question: What is displacement?
expectedAny: Difference between final and initial position

shortanswer.question: If velocity-time graph has positive slope, what is happening?
